Title: REVIEW: Odd Taxi: In the Woods - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Set to become an anime series, check out this variation of the Cinderella story about a down-trodden girl as she embarks on a fantasy romance with a side of ESP. ― Set in an alternate version of the late Meiji or early Taisho era, My Happy Marriage is a fairly classic take on the Cinderella story – especially if you remember that in many, if not most, variants of that tale Cinderella's father is aliv...

Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2106 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 7:35 pm            Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.      Back to top                  Juno016    Joined: 09 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 2158       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 11:02 pm              FireChick wrote:    Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.            It's definitely a heavy chunk of existential philosophy to take in all at once and I agree I wish it explored the same themes over a longer run, though I think this point will be subjective. If nothing else, it does feel weird to me, much like Dennou Coil, that it was produced as a children's show. Children's shows can have mature themes and definitely intentionally target adults with deeper messaging packaged in a kid-digestable package (in fact, I personally prefer this kind of all-ages approach for kids' shows), but Chikyuugai's central focus on the philosophy later would confuse and possibly disinterest most children I know.   Dennou Coil would still be the better series comparatively (it's my #2 anime of all time, just below Madoka☆Magica). It is a very rare hidden anime gem, beloved to Japanese audiences, with almost zero venues to watch it in the English in the 15 years since it aired, so the current run on Netflix might be your only chance to catch it while you still can!   Nonetheless, Chikyuugai is very much going to stick with me for a long time. Highly recommend it to anyone curious, especially since the short length provides more bang for less time investment! Also, there are a few subtle references to Dennou Coil for fans of that, plus one very obvious reference later in the show.   Thanks for the review! Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2106 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 7:35 pm            Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.      Back to top                  Juno016    Joined: 09 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 2158       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 11:02 pm              FireChick wrote:    Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.            It's definitely a heavy chunk of existential philosophy to take in all at once and I agree I wish it explored the same themes over a longer run, though I think this point will be subjective. If nothing else, it does feel weird to me, much like Dennou Coil, that it was produced as a children's show. Children's shows can have mature themes and definitely intentionally target adults with deeper messaging packaged in a kid-digestable package (in fact, I personally prefer this kind of all-ages approach for kids' shows), but Chikyuugai's central focus on the philosophy later would confuse and possibly disinterest most children I know.   Dennou Coil would still be the better series comparatively (it's my #2 anime of all time, just below Madoka☆Magica). It is a very rare hidden anime gem, beloved to Japanese audiences, with almost zero venues to watch it in the English in the 15 years since it aired, so the current run on Netflix might be your only chance to catch it while you still can!   Nonetheless, Chikyuugai is very much going to stick with me for a long time. Highly recommend it to anyone curious, especially since the short length provides more bang for less time investment! Also, there are a few subtle references to Dennou Coil for fans of that, plus one very obvious reference later in the show.   Thanks for the review! Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2106 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 7:35 pm            Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.      Back to top                  Juno016    Joined: 09 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 2158       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 11:02 pm              FireChick wrote:    Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.            It's definitely a heavy chunk of existential philosophy to take in all at once and I agree I wish it explored the same themes over a longer run, though I think this point will be subjective. If nothing else, it does feel weird to me, much like Dennou Coil, that it was produced as a children's show. Children's shows can have mature themes and definitely intentionally target adults with deeper messaging packaged in a kid-digestable package (in fact, I personally prefer this kind of all-ages approach for kids' shows), but Chikyuugai's central focus on the philosophy later would confuse and possibly disinterest most children I know.   Dennou Coil would still be the better series comparatively (it's my #2 anime of all time, just below Madoka☆Magica). It is a very rare hidden anime gem, beloved to Japanese audiences, with almost zero venues to watch it in the English in the 15 years since it aired, so the current run on Netflix might be your only chance to catch it while you still can!   Nonetheless, Chikyuugai is very much going to stick with me for a long time. Highly recommend it to anyone curious, especially since the short length provides more bang for less time investment! Also, there are a few subtle references to Dennou Coil for fans of that, plus one very obvious reference later in the show.   Thanks for the review! Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2106 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 7:35 pm            Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.      Back to top                  Juno016    Joined: 09 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 2158       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 11:02 pm              FireChick wrote:    Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.            It's definitely a heavy chunk of existential philosophy to take in all at once and I agree I wish it explored the same themes over a longer run, though I think this point will be subjective. If nothing else, it does feel weird to me, much like Dennou Coil, that it was produced as a children's show. Children's shows can have mature themes and definitely intentionally target adults with deeper messaging packaged in a kid-digestable package (in fact, I personally prefer this kind of all-ages approach for kids' shows), but Chikyuugai's central focus on the philosophy later would confuse and possibly disinterest most children I know.   Dennou Coil would still be the better series comparatively (it's my #2 anime of all time, just below Madoka☆Magica). It is a very rare hidden anime gem, beloved to Japanese audiences, with almost zero venues to watch it in the English in the 15 years since it aired, so the current run on Netflix might be your only chance to catch it while you still can!   Nonetheless, Chikyuugai is very much going to stick with me for a long time. Highly recommend it to anyone curious, especially since the short length provides more bang for less time investment! Also, there are a few subtle references to Dennou Coil for fans of that, plus one very obvious reference later in the show.   Thanks for the review! It might be exclusive to blu-ray now. The dub is fantastic. I log on to rightstuf, and checked; the blu-ray does include the english dub! I'm  definitely ordering it today!   Bummer that Netflix couldn't get the rights.   Again thanks! I agree with the reviewer on all points.   I really wish Den-noh Coil would get dubbed. I am currently watching it now. As far as I know the only other title they ever dubbed was Tokyo Magnitude 8.0. Back to top                  anime-prime    Joined: 17 Mar 2020 		    Posts: 46       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 6:06 pm              YesNoMaybe wrote:    Oops! I meant MJ = Maiden Japan.   Is there something I'm not understanding what you're trying to say?   It states the languages spoken are English and Japanese.   Is that information wrong?         That information is correct. Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2106 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 7:35 pm            Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.      Back to top                  Juno016    Joined: 09 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 2158       Posted: Sun Apr 17, 2022 11:02 pm              FireChick wrote:    Ehh, I wasn't a fan of this one. I mean, the animation and soundtrack is great, and I actually liked seeing Touya go from a misanthropic edgelord to a more well-balanced, open-minded person throughout the series. Unfortunately, a lot of the over-technical sci-fi, philosophical ramblings, and the fact that the series tried to do way too much in too little time didn't do it for me. It just felt really overstuffed, and had it cut out a lot of its fat, it might have been better and more streamlined. But that's just me.            It's definitely a heavy chunk of existential philosophy to take in all at once and I agree I wish it explored the same themes over a longer run, though I think this point will be subjective. If nothing else, it does feel weird to me, much like Dennou Coil, that it was produced as a children's show. Children's shows can have mature themes and definitely intentionally target adults with deeper messaging packaged in a kid-digestable package (in fact, I personally prefer this kind of all-ages approach for kids' shows), but Chikyuugai's central focus on the philosophy later would confuse and possibly disinterest most children I know.   Dennou Coil would still be the better series comparatively (it's my #2 anime of all time, just below Madoka☆Magica). It is a very rare hidden anime gem, beloved to Japanese audiences, with almost zero venues to watch it in the English in the 15 years since it aired, so the current run on Netflix might be your only chance to catch it while you still can!   Nonetheless, Chikyuugai is very much going to stick with me for a long time. Highly recommend it to anyone curious, especially since the short length provides more bang for less time investment! Also, there are a few subtle references to Dennou Coil for fans of that, plus one very obvious reference later in the show.   Thanks for the review! Data: Everyone's talking about 86, a recent light novel anime that tackles racism head on. While initially it seemed to be handling its moral quandary in a very basic way, 86 has since broke away for something deeper and even more horrific. ―  Everyone's talking about 86, a recent light novel anime that tackles racism head on. Data: column          13 comments       This Week in Anime - Is Mars Red Too High Brow?   May  5, 03:00 13 comments                 anime    Vampires are a dime a dozen, so what does it take to make a bloodsucker show stand out? MARS RED aptly blends a period piece, the anxiety of Westernization, and a growing military with all the showmanship of the theatrical stage. Is it too obtuse for genre enthusiasts or just what vamp fans need? ―  Vampires are a dime a dozen, so what does it take to make a bloodsucker show stand out? MARS RED aptly...

Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives                   All material Copyright © 1998-2022 Anime News Network. NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives

Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook.  Session 5 – Shawne Kleckner ANN's Christopher Macdonald talks Shawne Kleckner, CEO and Founder of The Right Stuf International, about TRSI's 30 years in the anime industry, the company's plans for the rest of 2020 and some of the craziest things that the Darklord has seen in the last 30 years. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.    Session 4 - Fall Anime Season Trailer Watch Party  ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Leo Rydel strap in for a spine-tingling marathon of every. single. anime trailer for the Fall 2020 season.Tune in live on YouTube, Facebook, and Twitch on Tuesday, September 22nd at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific to get a head start on the new season before Preview Guide kicks off on October 2!   Watch on YouTube.  Session 3 – Hiro Mashima ANN's Kim Morissy talks to Hiro Mashima about Fairy Tail, Edens Zero and life as a manga artist. We'll also be asking fan submitted questions! Want to submit a question? You can either submit them in our forum here or on Twitter with the hashtag #askmashima (make sure to tag @anime). The deadline to submit questions is 5PM EDT / 2 PM PDT on Friday, September 4th.  Join us September 15th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT for the Mashima Session. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide. View on YouTube Here.  Session 2 – Our Favorite Anime of Summer 2020 ANN Executive Editor Lynzee Loveridge and reviewers Rebecca Silverman, James Beckett, and Caitlin Moore countdown their favorite anime of this summer. What are you watching and what should you be watching?  View on YouTube Here.  Session 1 – Gibiate Online Premiere On July 14th, ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole hosted the Online Premiere of the new anime Gibiate before it's Crunchyroll debut. Featuring character designs by Yoshitaka Amano and an all-star team including Tetsuya Kakihara and Sugizo. Following the premiere, Mike interviewed Gibiate Producer Ryō Aoki and Director Masahiko Komino. Did you miss the premiere? Our premiere was only available live, but we're able to continue to share Mike Toole's exclusive interview!  View on YouTube Here.     discuss this in the forum (18 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    CONNECT homepage / archives

Title: Home - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: CONNECTHome            Welcome to Anime News Network Connect! A collaboration between ANN and Anime NYC, ANN Connect is a new way to bring anime fans, anime creators, and the anime industry together during a time when we're all physically remote. Across this summer and fall, ANN Connect will present anime premieres, in-depth interviews with voice actors and creative talent, industry panels, and much more. Join us together online for a super streaming anime club! You can watch our live sessions on Anime News Network's official YouTube, Facebook and Twitch channels! LAST SESSION  Session 16 – Spring Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and James Beckett watch every single anime trailer for Spring 2021 LIVE! It's one of the most packed seasons in years; can they survive? Can you?  Watch it on on Facebook or Twitch.     NEXT SESSION  Session 17 – How to Edit Manga Meet the Manga Editors on March 25 at 8 Eastern / 5 Pacific! Take deep dive into the manga editing world with Ajani Oloye (Manga Editor/Translator), Carl Li (Editor, Yen Press), Haruko Hashimoto (Editor, Kodansha Comics), and Tania Biswas (Senior Editor, Square Enix). The panelists will discuss the philosophy and practice of manga editing and chat live throughout the talk! Moderated by Mark de Vera (Sales and Marketing Director, Yen Press & Wannabe Manga Editor). Watch it and chat live with the editors on YouTube. Also streaming on Facebook and Twitch, but the live-chat is only on YouTube .   PAST SESSIONS  Session 15 – Mike Daniels Lynzee Loveridge is joined by very special guest, Mike Daniels! The NFL Pro Bowler takes a deep dive into his nerdier side - geeking out about Dragon Ball Z, Gundam, Berserk, Tenchi Muyo!, and more! Learn about Mike's personal history with anime, being a geek dad, and the amazing intersection of anime and pro sports!  Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 14 – Jujutsu Kaisen A follow up to our interview with Jujutsu Kaien voice actor Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), ANN's Jacki Jing speaks with cast members Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), Ray Chase (Ryomen Sukuna), and Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki)! Learn all about anime's cursed sensation in this mega interview!   Watch it on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 13 – Robbie Daymond Join us for a special interview voice acting superstar Robbie Daymond about lending his voice to one of 2020 and 2021's biggest shows - Jujutsu Kaisen! Hear from the voice of Megumi Fushiguro about the new shonen megahit!  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 12 – Winter Anime Season Trailer Watch Party ANN's Lynzee Loveridge, Jacki Jing, and Mike Toole remember the reason for the season by watching every single anime trailer for Winter 2020 LIVE! Has Japan filled our stockings with presents or coal? Watch and chat along as we go ani-wassailing together!  Watch it on on YouTube or Facebook.  Session 11 – Mangamo A-Go-Go Calling all manga fans! Join Anime News Network manga expert Rebecca Silverman for an all-out manga discussion with Mangamo executive editor and co-founder Dallas Middaugh, whose career in manga publishing spans two decades with stops at Crunchyroll and Penguin Random House. You'll get the scoop on titles like Mangamo's December Featured Titles, latest releases and more with Rebecca's thoughts, and why Dallas curated these titles just for you in Mangamo's library, plus exciting new announcements! Mangamo is the manga subscription app that gives you access to 300+ titles from multiple publishers without limits and without ads, all while supporting manga creators. Mangamo is now available globally for iOS and Android and is offering a 30-day free trial for all new users.  Watch it on YouTube, or Facebook.  Session 10 – Case Closed Producer Keiichi Ishiyama ANN's Kim Morissy sits down with longtime Case Closed producer Keiichi Ishiyama for a special interview to celebrate the US releases of three Case Closed feature films! Case Closed is one of the most beloved anime sagas in Japan, and American fans can now see some of Conan's biggest cases for the first time -- Case Closed: Episode ‘One’ and Zero the Enforcer both available now and The Crimson Love Letter available for download Nov. 19! And before you dive into these Case Closed mysteries, learn from Ishiyama-san about what goes into making Case Closed, how they balance creating a movie and over 30 episodes every year, and how involved manga creator Gosho Aoyama is in the movies!  Watch it on Facebook. Session 9 – Halloween Pumpkins with Ciarán Strange Join the Anime News Network team and Special Guest Ciarán Strange for the live revealing of this year's Halloween Pumpkin Carving Contest Winners! ANN and Ciarán will count down their favorites before revealing 2020's Pumpkin Carving Champion - plus an extra spooky surprise from Ciarán!  Watch on: YouTube or Twitch    Session 8 – My Hero Academia: Deku & Bakugo Voice Actor Interview Celebrate the DVD and Blu-ray release of My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising with an interview with the US voices of Deku (Justin Briner) and Bakugo (Clifford Chapin). Learn about the latest My Hero Academia movie, Deku and Bakugo's evolving relationship, and more! Watch on: YouTube, or facebook.  Session 7 – Attack on Titan ANN's Jacki Jing talks with Attack on Titan voice actor Bryce Papenbrook (Eren) and Mike McFarland (ADR Director and voice of Jean) about all things Attack on Titan. Are you ready for Attack on Titan The Final Season? Join us October 1st at 9PM ET / 6PM PT.  Watch on: YouTube, facebook.  Session 6 – Retro Crush ANN Editor at Large Mike Toole chats with Mary Gibson (Head of Acquisition) and Will Chao (Head of Content) from RetroCrush. Mary and Will are two of the key people bringing this new streaming portal dedicated to classic anime to life. Learn all this very different streaming site, its founding, community, and why Charge Man Ken is the best anime ever. Maybe. Join us September 30th at 9PM EDT / 6PM PDT. This session will be streamed on Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube worldwide. Watch on: YouTube, Twitch, facebook. We might even talk about Covid-19. Join us on September 24 at 9PM Eastern / 6 PM Pacific. This session will be streamed live on Twitch, Facebook and YouTube and will be accessible worldwide with fan interaction encouraged. Watch on: YouTube.
